The claim was made by Assembly Speaker R: R-Rochester) on Facebook, stating that the nine-day deer hunt contributes more than $1.3 billion in revenue to the state of Wisconsin.
The claim was supported by Governor Scot: hunt statements, citing a 2006 study titled "Hunting in America" by the Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies.
The 2006 study estimated direct spending: 899 million, which includes expenses such as gas, food, firearms, lodging, and other essentials.
The study also estimated the: ripple effect" of the hunters' spending on the broader economy, quantifying indirect spending by retailers, wholesalers, manufacturers, and their employees. This indirect spending contributed to the total figure of $1.39 billion, which was cited by Vos and others.
